intro: Amphymenium, commonly known as the common amphymenium, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. The flowers are typically arranged in whorls along the stem, and they are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The genus includes several species, many of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Amphymenium plants are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant floral displays and adaptability to various soil types.
